column2: At a place that was called "The Ram's Couch" they fastened the Argo.
column3: At a place that was called "The Ram's Couch" they fastened the Argo.

column2: Then they marched to the field of Ares, where the king and the Colchian people were.
column3: Then they marched to the field of Ares, where the king and the Colchian people were.

column2: Jason, carrying his shield and spear, went before the king.
column3: Jason, carrying his shield and spear, went before the king.

column2: From the king's hand he took the gleaming helmet that held the dragon's teeth. This he put into the hands of Theseus, who went with him.

column2: Then with the spear and shield in his hands, with his sword girt across his shoulders, and with his mantle stripped off, Jason looked across the field of Ares.
column3: Then with the spear and shield in his hands, with his sword girt across his shoulders, and with his mantle stripped off, Jason looked across the field of Ares.

column2: He followed the tracks until he came to the lair of the fire-breathing bulls.
column3: He followed the tracks until he came to the lair of the fire breathing bulls.

column2: Out of that lair, which was underground, smoke and fire belched.
column3: Out of that lair, which was underground, smoke and fire belched.

column2: He set his feet firmly upon the ground and he held his shield before him.
column3: He set his feet firmly upon the ground and he held his shield before him.

column2: He awaited the onset of the bulls.
column3: He awaited the onset of the bulls.

column2: They came clanging up with loud bellowing, breathing out fire.
column3: They came clanging up with loud bellowing, breathing out fire.

column2: They lowered their heads, and with mighty, iron-tipped horns they came to gore and trample him.
column3: They lowered their heads, and with mighty, iron tipped horns they came to gore and trample him.

column2: Medea's charm had made him strong; Medea's charm had made his shield impregnable.
column3: Medea's charm had made him strong; Medea's charm had made his shield impregnable.

column2: The rush of the bulls did not overthrow him.
column3: The rush of the bulls did not overthrow him.

column2: His comrades shouted to see him standing firmly there, and in wonder the Colchians gazed upon him.
column3: His comrades shouted to see him standing firmly there, and in wonder the Colchians gazed upon him.

column2: The bulls roared mightily.
column3: The bulls roared mightily.

column2: Grasping the horns of the bull that was upon his right hand, Jason dragged him until he had brought him beside the yoke of bronze.
column3: Grasping the horns of the bull that was upon his right hand, Jason dragged him until he had brought him beside the yoke of bronze.

column2: Striking the brazen knees of the bull suddenly with his foot he forced him down.
column3: Striking the brazen knees of the bull suddenly with his foot he forced him down.

column2: Then he smote the other bull as it rushed upon him, and it too he forced down upon its knees.
column3: Then he smote the other bull as it rushed upon him, and it too he forced down upon its knees.

column2: Castor and Polydeuces held the yoke to him.
column3: Castor and Polydeuces held the yoke to him.

column2: Jason bound it upon the necks of the bulls.
column3: Jason bound it upon the necks of the bulls.

column2: He fastened the plow to the yoke.
column3: He fastened the plow to the yoke.

column2: Then he took his shield and set it upon his back, and grasping the handles of the plow he started to make the furrow.
column3: Then he took his shield and set it upon his back, and grasping the handles of the plow he started to make the furrow.

column2: Beside Jason Theseus went holding the helmet that held the dragon's teeth.
column3: Beside Jason Theseus went holding the helmet that held the dragon's teeth.

column2: The hard ground was torn up by the plow of adamant, and the clods groaned as they were cast up.
column3: The hard ground was torn up by the plow of adamant, and the clods groaned as they were cast up.

column2: Jason flung the teeth between the open sods, often turning his head in fear that the deadly crop of the Earth-born Men were rising behind him.
column3: Jason flung the teeth between the open sods, often turning his head in fear that the deadly crop of the Earth born Men were rising behind him.

column2: By the time that a third of the day was finished the field of Ares had been plowed and sown.
column3: By the time that a third of the day was finished the field of Ares had been plowed and sown.

column2: As yet the furrows were free of the Earth-born Men.
column3: As yet the furrows were free of the Earth born Men.

column2: Jason went down to the river and filled his helmet full of water and drank deeply.
column3: Jason went down to the river and filled his helmet full of water and drank deeply.

column2: And his knees that were stiffened with the plowing he bent until they were made supple again.
column3: And his knees that were stiffened with the plowing he bent until they were made supple again.

column2: He saw the field rising into mounds.
column3: He saw the field rising into mounds.

column2: It seemed that there were graves all over the field of Ares.
column3: It seemed that there were graves all over the field of Ares.

column2: Then he saw spears and shields and helmets rising up out of the earth.
column3: Then he saw spears and shields and helmets rising up out of the earth.

column2: Then armed warriors sprang up, a fierce battle cry upon their lips.
column3: Then armed warriors sprang up, a fierce battle cry upon their lips.

column2: Jason remembered the counsel of Medea.
column3: Jason remembered the counsel of Medea.

column2: The Colchians shouted to see such a stone cast by the hands of one man.
column3: The Colchians shouted to see such a stone cast by the hands of one man.

column2: Right into the middle of the Earth-born Men the stone came.
column3: Right into the middle of the Earth born Men the stone came.

column2: They leaped upon it like hounds, striking at one another as they came together.
column3: They leaped upon it like hounds, striking at one another as they came together.

column2: The Earth-born Men, as fast as they arose, went down before the weapons in the hands of their brethren.
column3: The Earth born Men, as fast as they arose, went down before the weapons in the hands of their brethren.

column2: He slew some that had risen out of the earth only as far as the shoulders; he slew others whose feet were still in the earth; he slew others who were ready to spring upon him.
column3: He slew some that had risen out of the earth only as far as the shoulders; he slew others whose feet were still in the earth; he slew others who were ready to spring upon him.

column2: Soon all the Earth-born Men were slain, and the furrows ran with their dark blood as channels run with water in springtime.
column3: Soon all the Earth born Men were slain, and the furrows ran with their dark blood as channels run with water in springtime.

column2: The Argonauts shouted loudly for Jason's victory.
column3: The Argonauts shouted loudly for Jason's victory.

column2: The Colchians followed him.
column3: The Colchians followed him.

column2: Day faded, and Jason's contest was ended.
column3: Day faded, and Jason's contest was ended.

column2: In the assembly place, with his son Apsyrtus beside him, and with the furious Colchians all around him, the king stood: on his breast was the gleaming corselet that Ares had given him, and on his head was that golden helmet with its four plumes that made him look as if he were truly the son of Helios, the Sun.

column2: Lightnings flashed from his great eyes; he spoke fiercely to the Colchians, holding in his hand his bronze-topped spear.
column3: Lightnings flashed from his great eyes; he spoke fiercely to the Colchians, holding in his hand his bronze topped spear.

column2: He would have them attack the strangers and burn the Argo.
column3: He would have them attack the strangers and burn the Argo.

column2: So the king spoke, and the Colchians, hating all strangers, shouted around him.
column3: So the king spoke, and the Colchians, hating all strangers, shouted around him.

column2: Word of what her father had said was brought to Medea.
column3: Word of what her father had said was brought to Medea.

column2: They would not go, she knew, without the Golden Fleece; then she, Medea, would have to show them how to gain the Fleece.
column3: They would not go, she knew, without the Golden Fleece; then she, Medea, would have to show them how to gain the Fleece.

column2: Forever afterward she would be dependent on the kindness of strangers.
column3: Forever afterward she would be dependent on the kindness of strangers.

column2: Medea wept when she thought of all this.
column3: Medea wept when she thought of all this.

column2: The palace doors were all heavily bolted, but Medea did not have to pull back the bolts.
column3: The palace doors were all heavily bolted, but Medea did not have to pull back the bolts.

column2: As she chanted her Magic Song the bolts softly drew back, the doors softly opened.
column3: As she chanted her Magic Song the bolts softly drew back, the doors softly opened.

column2: Swiftly she went along the ways that led to the river.
column3: Swiftly she went along the ways that led to the river.

column2: She called to them, and Phrontis, Chalciope's son, heard the cry and knew the voice.
column3: She called to them, and Phrontis, Chalciope's son, heard the cry and knew the voice.

column2: To Jason he spoke, and Jason quickly went to where Medea stood.
column3: To Jason he spoke, and Jason quickly went to where Medea stood.

column2: She clasped Jason's hand and she drew him with her.
column3: She clasped Jason's hand and she drew him with her.

column2: The Golden Fleece, she said, "the time has come when you must pluck the Golden Fleece off the oak in the grove of Ares." When she said these words all Jason's being became taut like the string of a bow.
column3: The Golden Fleece, she said, "the time has come when you must pluck the Golden Fleece off the oak in the grove of Ares." When she said these words all Jason's being became taut like the string of a bow.

column2: It was then the hour when huntsmen cast sleep from their eyes--huntsmen who never sleep away the end of the night, but who are ever ready to be up and away with their hounds before the beams of the sun efface the track and the scent of the quarry.
column3: It was then the hour when huntsmen cast sleep from their eyes-huntsmen who never sleep away the end of the night, but who are ever ready to be up and away with their hounds before the beams of the sun efface the track and the scent of the quarry.

column2: Along a path that went from the river Medea drew Jason.
column3: Along a path that went from the river Medea drew Jason.

column2: They entered a grove.
column3: They entered a grove.

column2: Then Jason saw something that was like a cloud filled with the light of the rising sun.
column3: Then Jason saw something that was like a cloud filled with the light of the rising sun

column2: It hung from a great oak tree.
column3: It hung from a great oak tree.

column2: His hand let slip Medea's hand and he went to seize the Fleece.
column3: His hand let slip Medea's hand and he went to seize the Fleece.

column2: As he did he heard a dreadful hiss.
column3: As he did he heard a dreadful hiss.

column2: And then he saw the guardian of the Golden Fleece.
column3: And then he saw the guardian of the Golden Fleece.

column2: Coiled all around the tree, with outstretched neck and keen and sleepless eyes, was a deadly serpent.
column3: Coiled all around the tree, with outstretched neck and keen and sleepless eyes, was a deadly serpent.

column2: Its hiss ran all through the grove and the birds that were wakening up squawked in terror.
column3: Its hiss ran all through the grove and the birds that were wakening up squawked in terror.

column2: Like rings of smoke that rise one above the other, the coils of the serpent went around the tree--coils covered by hard and gleaming scales.
column3: Like rings of smoke that rise one above the other, the coils of the serpent went around the tree-coils covered by hard and gleaming scales.

column2: As she sang, the coils around the tree grew slack.
column3: As she sang, the coils around the tree grew slack.

column2: Like a dark, noiseless wave the serpent sank down on the ground.
column3: Like a dark, noiseless wave the serpent sank down on the ground.

column2: But still its jaws were open, and those dreadful jaws threatened Jason.
column3: But still its jaws were open, and those dreadful jaws threatened Jason.

column2: Medea, with a newly cut spray of juniper dipped in a mystic brew, touched its deadly eyes.
column3: Medea, with a newly cut spray of juniper dipped in a mystic brew, touched its deadly eyes.

column2: And still she chanted her Magic Song.
column3: And still she chanted her Magic Song.

column2: The serpent's jaws closed; its eyes became deadened; far through the grove its length was stretched out.
column3: The serpent's jaws closed; its eyes became deadened; far through the grove its length was stretched out.

column2: Then Jason took the Golden Fleece.
column3: Then Jason took the Golden Fleece.

column2: As he raised his hands to it, its brightness was such as to make a flame on his face.
column3: As he raised his hands to it, its brightness was such as to make a flame on his face.

column2: Medea called to him.
column3: Medea called to him.

column2: They came to the river and down to the place where the Argo was moored. The heroes who were aboard started up, astonished to see the Fleece that shone as with the lightning of Zeus.
column3: They came to the river and down to the place where the Argo was moored. The heroes who were aboard started up, astonished to see the Fleece that shone as with the lightning of Zeus.

column2: Over Medea Jason cast it, and he lifted her aboard the Argo.
column3: Over Medea Jason cast it, and he lifted her aboard the Argo.

column2: O friends, he cried, "the quest on which we dared the gulfs of the sea and the wrath of kings is accomplished, thanks to the help of this maiden.
column3: O friends, he cried, "the quest on which we dared the gulfs of the sea and the wrath of kings is accomplished, thanks to the help of this maiden.

column2: Then he drew his sword and cut the hawsers of the ship, calling upon the heroes to drive the Argo on.
column3: Then he drew his sword and cut the hawsers of the ship, calling upon the heroes to drive the Argo on.
